channel.title: Urgent Help With Webclient
channel.description:
So i've been creating a webclient that looks very nice but I keep getting this... [IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/ux4ly.png[/img] I cant fix it and here is the code for the index.html [code] Title

Title

Home Page
Forums!
Download
[/code] I have my .jar client already but what do I do form here? Please help!

item.title: Urgent Help With Webclient
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Applets and servlets are two completely different things, an applet is run over a browser where as a servlet is run over a server. An applet is server sided programming, a servlet is client sided programming.

Read full topic

item.title: Urgent Help With Webclient
item.dc:creator: @T_h_3 T h 3
item.description:
@T_h_3 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:10, topic:471254”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=588792.msg4174581#msg4174581 date=1354832441]

Call your webhost, and make sure they still have java support. Godaddy.com just stopped supporting java for webhosting.
[/quote]WTF are you talking about? If an applet is called, it will load…

I second this, what the love are you talking about?

GoDaddy wouldn’t stop, “supporting java” for web hosting. When a java applet is called, it will load, and use resources from the clients computer (meaning JRE/Java), the applet doesn’t rely on anything from the web host. Other then having the jar uploaded to it, which GoDaddy would never stop doing.[/quote]
http://support.godaddy.com/groups/web-hosting/forum/topic/does-godaddy-support-java-servlet/

This happened a few weeks back. I’m now using my a spare cpu to host my webclient via apache.

Read full topic

item.title: Urgent Help With Webclient

item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“RiiPiiNFtW, post:9, topic:471254”][quote author=T h 3 link=topic=588792.msg4174531#msg4174531 date=1354826941]
Call your webhost, and make sure they still have java support. Godaddy.com just stopped supporting java for webhosting.
[/quote]WTF are you talking about? If an applet is called, it will load…[/quote]

I second this, what the fuck are you talking about?

GoDaddy wouldn’t stop, “supporting java” for web hosting. When a java applet is called, it will load, and use resources from the clients computer (meaning JRE/Java), the applet doesn’t rely on anything from the web host. Other then having the jar uploaded to it, which GoDaddy would never stop doing.

Read full topic

Personally I think its a defect with the signer or something cause I get this issue from time to time. I just have to keep redoing it lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Urgent Help With Webclient
item.dc:creator: @dmanman5 dmanman5
item.description:
@dmanman5 wrote:

So i’ve been creating a webclient that looks very nice but I keep getting this…

ux4ly.png1144×671

I cant fix it and here is the code for the index.html

[code]
<!doctype html>

<title>Title</title>
<meta name="description" content="GodScapeRevolution">
<meta name="author" content="">

<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">

<link rel="shortcut icon" href="favicon.ico">
<link rel="apple-touch-icon" href="apple-touch-icon.png">
<link rel="stylesheet" href="css/style.css">

<script src="js/libs/modernizr-1.7.min.js"></script>

<div id="dimLights"></div>

<div class="wrapper">
	<div class="container">
</div>
	
	<div class="container clearfix" id="main">
		<div class="top">
			<h1><span>Title</span></h1>
			<div class="buttons">
				<a href="http://gscc.net23.net/vb/index.php"  target="_blank">
					<div id="dim">
						Home Page
					</div>
				</a>
				<a href="http://gscc.net23.net/vb/index.php"  target="_blank">
					<div id="dim">
						Forums!
					</div>
				</a>
				<a href="Gscc.net23.net/client.jar"  target="_blank">
					<div id="download">
						Download
					</div>
				</a>
			</div>
		</div><!-- End .top -->
		<center><div class="mid clearfix">
			<div id="webclient">
				<applet name="Client" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class">

<script src="https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.4.2/jquery.min.js"></script>
<script>!window.jQuery && document.write(unescape('%3Cscript src="js/libs/jquery-1.5.1.min.js"%3E%3C/script%3E'))</script>
<script src="js/plugins.js"></script>
<script src="js/script.js"></script>
<script>
	$(function() {
		$('#dim').click(function() {
			$('#dimLights').css({ 'display' : 'block', 'opacity' : 0 });
			$("#dimLights").animate({"opacity" : 1});
		});
		
		//Close
		$('#dimLights').click(function() {
			closeLights();
		});
		$(document).keyup(function(e) {
		  if (e.keyCode == 27) { closeLights(); }   // esc
		});
		
		function closeLights() {
			$("#dimLights").stop().animate({ 'opacity' : 0}, function() {
				$('#dimLights').css({ 'display' : 'none' });
			});
		}
	});
</script>
<!--[if lt IE 7 ]>
<script src="js/libs/dd_belatedpng.js"></script>
<script> DD_belatedPNG.fix('img, .png_bg');</script>
<![endif]-->


</body>
[/code]

I have my .jar client already but what do I do form here? Please help!

Read full topic
